text:
Q: What are the disadvantages of aspect-oriented programming (AOP)? A:

I would not call it a critical disadvantage, but the biggest problem I have seen is one of developer experience and ability to adapt. Not all developers yet understand the difference between declarative and imperative programming.

We make use of the policy injection application block in EntLib 4.1 pretty extensively as well as Unity for DI and it's just not something that sinks in quickly for some people. I find myself explaining over and over again to the same people why the application is not behaving in the way they expect. It generally starts off them explaining something and me saying "see that declaration above the method." :) Some people get it right away, love it and become extremely productive, but others struggle.

A learning curve is not unique to AOP, but it seems to have a higher learning curve than other things that your average developer encounters.

Q: Delphi ignores selected vs deselected items in TListbox ownerdraw A:

You should rely on State instead of ItemIndex being equal to Index. Especially if odSelected in State then is more appropriate to achieve your goal.

Q: Programming with Threads in Java A:

My question is, will nn point to the object of the Thread class or just call method start() and after that method run() by itself?

It's both:

  • nn will reference the NT4 instance as you wrote NT4 nn = new NT4();. If you don't change the value of the variable nn, it will continue referencing the object you have created.
  • The constructor of NT4 will call the start() method, which will start the thread, which will execute the run() method.

So you will have a reference to the NT4 instance, which is a thread executing the run() method.

Q: Printing a stack trace of a hung thread A:

The problem is that the state of the stream in the C++ runtime library could be inconsistent at the time the signal handler is executed. Therefore, you should not be calling any stream I/O functions from the C++ standard library in the signal handler, as this may cause the program to crash.

However, depending on which platform you are using, it is likely possible to print output from the signal handler in a safe way.

For example, on Linux, it is safe to call functions that are explicitly listed as async-signal-safe. The system call write (which bypasses the C++ stream) is a function that is marked as async-signal-safe, so it allows you to print output safely from a signal handler.

Q: Why we need a master branch in Git-flow? A:

I agree. Resetting latest instead of merging release into latest would lose the history and would only serve the purpose of representing the current production state. (I probably should have worded that better.) By "doing the same thing" I meant it sounded like you were trying to avoid having a branch, by creating a branch with a different name. If you're willing to do that, a more targeted question might have been, "In Git Flow, can I reset master to release instead of merging release into master?" The answer to that question would have been, "Yes if you want to, but you lose the feature of the deployment history in a single place, which standard Git Flow provides."

Q: Aspect-oriented programming vs. object-oriented programming A:

In one sentence: AOP is a paradigm that aims to separate business logic code from non-business logic code and decrease the amount of boilerplate code, facilitating modularization and improved code maintenance.

Q: I am Using react-native-safe-area-context, But Expo gives Me Error A:

So what i did is:

rm -rf ~/.npm
rm -rf ~/.expo
rm -rf node_modules
rm -rf .expo

and then reinstall everything

npm install expo
npx expo install
npx expo start

That worked for me 👌

Q: OBDII requests (standard SAE J1979) A:

Added for reference.

As my Russian is weak, posted below is a google translated version of OP's comment.

Feel open to edit this wiki and improve.

List of PIDs to read that I want to know, in CHECKED_PIDS:
0x04 - Engine load = A*100/255 %
0x05 - Coolant temperature = A-40 °C
0x06 - Short-term fuel trim—Bank 1 = (A-128) * 100/128 %
0x07 - Long-term fuel trim—Bank 1 = (A-128) * 100/128 %
0x08 - Short-term fuel trim—Bank 2 = (A-128) * 100/128 %
0x09 - Long-term fuel trim—Bank 1 = (A-128) * 100/128 %
0x0a - Fuel pressure = A*3 kPa
0x0b - Intake manifold pressure = A kPa
0x0c - RPM = ((A*256)+B)/4 rpm
0x0d - Speed ​​= A km/h
0x0e - Ignition timing advance angle = A/2-64 deg relative to #1 cylinder
0x0f - Intake air temperature = A-40 C
0x10 - Mass air flow = ((A*256)+B)/100) grams/sec
0x11 - Throttle position = A*100/255 %
0x12 - Secondary air status, byte A:
  0 - no such system exists
  1 - air supply before the catalytic converter (upstream)
  2 - after the catalytic converter (downstream)
  4 - to the atmosphere
  8 - pump is on
0x1f - time elapsed since engine start
0x0f - intake air temperature = A-40 C
0x10 - mass air flow = ((A*256)+B)/100) grams/sec
0x11 - throttle position = A*100/255 %
0x12 - secondary air status, byte A:
